NCSU Data Assimilation¶

These pages document our use of the Data Assimilation Research Testbed (DART) with the Regional Ocean Modeling System (ROMS). While DART is designed to work on various flavors of UNIX/Linux, much of this documentation will focus specifically on our configuration of it on the Hatteras Cluster at the Renaissance Computing Institute.

Our suite of python scripts prepare super-observations (superobs) for assimilation and compare the ensemble assimilation algorithm with the 4-Dimensional Variational (4D-Var) assimilation algorithm included with ROMS.

Note well: When running diagnostics on DART output we should use the MATLAB scripts that come with the source code as much as possible. When I met with the Data Assimilation Research Section (DAReS), Jeff Anderson pointed out that my ensemble rank histograms were produced incorrectly and would never flatten out because I did not add random samples from the observation error distribution [1]. These types of subtle problems are already accounted for in the MATLAB scripts.
